intro: Tephrosia bequaertii, commonly known as the African blue pea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces striking blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland areas. Tephrosia bequaertii is also valued for its potential medicinal properties and use in traditional herbal remedies.
